verses.verse: "But now those who are younger <S%H6810><s%> than I have me in derision, <S%H7832><s%> whose fathers <S%H1><s%> I would have disdained <S%H3988><s%> to put <S%H7896><s%> with my sheep <S%H6629><s%> dogs. <S%H3611><s%>
Of what use <S%H4100><s%> is the strength <S%H3581><s%> of their hands <S%H3027><s%> to me, <S%H3624><s%> men in whom ripe age has perished? <S%H6><s%>

They are gaunt <S%H1565><s%> from lack <S%H2639><s%> and famine. <S%H3720><s%> They gnaw <S%H6207><s%> the dry ground, <S%H6723><s%> in the gloom <S%H570><s%> of waste <S%H4875><s%> and desolation. <S%H7722><s%>
They pluck <S%H6998><s%> salt herbs <S%H4408><s%> by the bushes. <S%H7880><s%> The roots <S%H8328><s%> of the broom <S%H7574><s%> are their food. <S%H3899><s%>
They are driven out <S%H1644><s%> from the midst <S%H1460><s%> of men. <S%H7321><s%> They cry after them as after a thief; <S%H1590><s%>
So that they dwell <S%H7931><s%> in frightful <S%H6178><s%> valleys, <S%H5158><s%> and in holes <S%H2356><s%> of the earth <S%H6083><s%> and of the rocks. <S%H3710><s%>
Among the bushes <S%H7880><s%> they bray; <S%H5101><s%> and under the nettles <S%H2738><s%> they are gathered together. <S%H5596><s%>
They are children <S%H1121><s%> of fools, <S%H5036><s%> yes, <S%H1121><s%> children of base men. <S%H8034><s%> They were flogged <S%H5217><s%> out of the land. <S%H776><s%>
"Now I have become their song. <S%H5058><s%> Yes, <S%H4405><s%> I am a byword to them.
They abhor <S%H8581><s%> me, <S%H7368><s%> they stand aloof from me, <S%H2820><s%> and don't hesitate to spit <S%H7536><s%> in my face. <S%H6440><s%>
For he has untied <S%H6605><s%> his cord, <S%H3499><s%> and afflicted <S%H6031><s%> me; <S%H7971><s%> and they have thrown off restraint <S%H7448><s%> before me. <S%H6440><s%>

On my right <S%H3225><s%> hand rise <S%H6965><s%> the rabble. <S%H6526><s%> They thrust aside <S%H7971><s%> my feet, <S%H7272><s%> They cast up <S%H5549><s%> against me their ways <S%H734><s%> of destruction. <S%H343><s%>
They mar <S%H5420><s%> my path, <S%H5410><s%> They set forward <S%H3276><s%> my calamity, <S%H1942><s%> without anyone <S%H5826><s%>'s help.
As through a wide <S%H7342><s%> breach <S%H6556><s%> they come, <S%H857><s%> in the midst <S%H8478><s%> of the ruin <S%H7722><s%> they roll themselves in. <S%H1556><s%>

Terrors <S%H1091><s%> have turned <S%H2015><s%> on me. <S%H7291><s%> They chase my honor <S%H5082><s%> as the wind. <S%H7307><s%> My welfare <S%H3444><s%> has passed away <S%H5674><s%> as a cloud. <S%H5645><s%>
"Now my soul <S%H5315><s%> is poured out <S%H8210><s%> within me. <S%H3117><s%> Days of affliction <S%H6040><s%> have taken hold on me. <S%H270><s%>
In the night season <S%H3915><s%> my bones <S%H6106><s%> are pierced <S%H5365><s%> in me, <S%H6207><s%> and the pains that gnaw me take no rest. <S%H7901><s%>
By great <S%H7230><s%> force <S%H3581><s%> is my garment <S%H3830><s%> disfigured. <S%H2664><s%> It binds me about <S%H247><s%> as the collar <S%H6310><s%> of my coat. <S%H3801><s%>
He has cast <S%H3384><s%> me into the mire. <S%H2563><s%> I have become like <S%H4911><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes. <S%H665><s%>
I cry <S%H7768><s%> to you, <S%H6030><s%> and you do not answer me. <S%H5975><s%> I stand up, and you gaze at me. <S%H995><s%>
You have turned <S%H2015><s%> to be cruel <S%H393><s%> to me. <S%H6108><s%> With the might of your hand <S%H3027><s%> you persecute me. <S%H7852><s%>
You lift me up <S%H5375><s%> to the wind, <S%H7307><s%> and drive <S%H7392><s%> me with it. <S%H4127><s%> You dissolve me in the storm. <S%H8454><s%>
For I know <S%H3045><s%> that you will bring <S%H7725><s%> me to death, <S%H4194><s%> To the house <S%H1004><s%> appointed <S%H4150><s%> for all living. <S%H2416><s%>
"However doesn't <S%H7971><s%> one stretch out a hand <S%H3027><s%> in his fall? <S%H1164><s%> Or in his calamity <S%H6365><s%> therefore cry for help? <S%H7769><s%>
Didn't <S%H1058><s%> I weep for him who was in trouble? <S%H7186><s%> Wasn't <S%H5315><s%> my soul grieved <S%H5701><s%> for the needy? <S%H34><s%>
When I looked <S%H6960><s%> for good, <S%H2896><s%> then evil <S%H7451><s%> came; <S%H935><s%> When I waited <S%H3176><s%> for light, <S%H216><s%> there came <S%H935><s%> darkness. <S%H652><s%>
My heart <S%H4578><s%> is troubled, <S%H7570><s%> and doesn't <S%H1826><s%> rest. Days <S%H3117><s%> of affliction <S%H6040><s%> have come on me. <S%H6923><s%>
I go <S%H1980><s%> mourning <S%H6937><s%> without the sun. <S%H2535><s%> I stand up <S%H6965><s%> in the assembly, <S%H6951><s%> and cry for help. <S%H7768><s%>
I am a brother <S%H251><s%> to jackals, <S%H8577><s%> and a companion <S%H7453><s%> to ostriches. <S%H1323><s%>
My skin <S%H5785><s%> grows black <S%H7835><s%> and peels from me. <S%H6106><s%> My bones are burned <S%H2787><s%> with heat. <S%H2721><s%>
Therefore my harp <S%H3658><s%> has turned to mourning, <S%H60><s%> and my pipe <S%H5748><s%> into the voice <S%H6963><s%> of those who weep. <S%H1058><s%>
